Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is grey in section, interior covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, with remains of three lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the exterior, containing a receipt for 46 phorai, probably of wine.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.209)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36500) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36500)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 366 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
